Posts.Title: Breast hardening 15 years after radiation belamom meme31

Posts.Content: meme31 wrote: I've been off and on here for a few years with bumps that never show up anywhere on images.  So I feel like i'm just getting to know my breasts and what is normal.  So when i saw a surgeon in Aug of 2012 after having a mammo and us for a lump that didn't show up he said he felt it was a cyst.  He said he felt three actually about the size of a jelly bean and his level of suspicion was 0.  So good just come back if it grows.  Of course it's grown since then and feels like a small tootsie roll kind of squishy yet firm.  I went thru the early detection works again and they paid for me to have yet another mammo and us and all is good.  So they don't want to send me to a surgeon. I don't have insurance and if you are dx with bc thru this program you are automatically approved for medicaid. If i see someone on my own i may have to pay and if it would actually turn out to be something bad i don't know how i would pay for it.   So i'm wondering if i should fight and ask them to cover it or go see someone on my own or just let it be?  I'm not comfortable having something growing in there but if it keeps not showing up then i would think it's nothing.  It's in the upper outer most part of my breast about 1 oclock in the left one almost along the edge of my breast.  I'm only scattered fibroglandular tissues so not considered heavily dense.  But of course it's in the dense area i do have.  Do women with not heavily dense breasts have things missed on tests? I would just love some thoughts please.  Thank you! Posts.Title: I would love some advice please! meme31 meme31

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2013 06:54AM meme31 wrote: Thank you ablydec, you are right. I'm 34 so not a high risk at all for age. I just have to tell myself that with any health concerns i have for myself.  It's so much easier to be insistant for the ones i love than myself.  Such is the life of a mother.  I've left a message for the nurse navigator at the hospital i had the diagnostics run at and hoping she will get me in to see a surgeon.  If she cant then i will go on my own to another hospital(KU med center, recently deemed an NCI hospital).  I already have a referrell to see a surgeon there from my primary doc for the lump.  I told the lady setting up the appt. i had to find out if i can get it through the EDW works first then let her know if i needed to set up the appt. with her or not.  That hospital is a good one and i may be able to get charity payment for some or all the things if i have to see them.  It's funny because i would prefer that hospital in the first place but the EDW doesn't work through them.  We will see where i end up going, but i'm going somewhere;) Thanx again ladies!
Posts.Title: I would love some advice please! meme31 meme31

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2013 08:50AM meme31 wrote: I made my appt. on my own through KU and they are sending me financial paperwork to fill out so at least some of it should be covered.  They were really good working with my twin sister to pay her bills since she doesn't qualify for medicaid or disability since she recently had a lipoma removed from inside her spinal cord and was in the hospital for 5 weeks and still going to rehab. We can never be too careful I think, I know statistics don't matter really because we are all people and not numbers and my sister was in the 0.01%(something like that)for her tumor and location of it.  So i'm going on May 16 to the breast clinic to see a BS.  It feels good to have it scheduled.
Posts.Title: I would love some advice please! meme31 meme31

Posts.Content: Nov 16, 2010 12:14AM meme31 wrote: Thank you for the prompt response-everything seems to be going  so slow.  Did you get a dx yet from your tests?  When i called another hospital's breast center she tried to reassure me as to the first radiologist reading it well and it's run through the computer for detection she said probably but i could have another mammo for $150. i've also done some researching on the cad technology which is the computer reading it and it defintitely doesn't make me feel more secure. I feel like i have a terrible time getting people to give me a straight answer. She never said if we could bring in records for another opinion or not.  i might just have to call back and bother them again-although it seems like that's all i keep doing with everyone involved, records, nurses, edc.  I read several papers that said asymmetry was commonly seen on mammo's but it stated 3% of all mammos it showed up on.  Is three percent common, if it was then the 20%of biopsies that turned out malignant would be a regular occurence rather than being assured it's not common.
Posts.Title: second opinion-do i have to have another mammo for that? meme31 meme31

Posts.Content: meme31 wrote: I'm not comfortable with my dx from my mammo and am wondering if i have to do the test over again somewhere else or just have another look at the test i already had?  I have posted a few other things with my info within the past couple weeks.  i don't have insurance and one place said they would do another mammo for $150.  Do i ask for another radiologist to read it or someone else-surgeon?  I've read alot of radiologist papers and teaching files on line and it seems that my asymmetry maybe should have rated a birads-3 not 2.  I just don't feel settled after the mammo and the us- which i insisted on- was neg.  But i told them where to look for the asymmetry-she didn't know and i don't know if i was right on where  to look.  It did not say which quadrant or postition it was seen on only upper right breast.  ???  I'm not worried about the lump which started the initial process so much now-i think a couple of times i have felt the same in other breast at same spot-which is good-it's harder to find but i think it's there?  I've read about ILC and it may present as asymmetry on mammo.  But the mammo most often doesn't even pick it up because of how it grows.  This is starting to drive me nuts and just want to know for sure there is nothing there to worry about.  It seems that asymmetry doesn't show up that often on mammo's and maybe that's why i haven't gotten much info from others on here about it.  The only stuff i have found is on the ILC thread and even there noone answered my post.  I feel like because im only 31 that maybe things aren't being done as carefully.  Maybe more mammo pics should have been taken.  I still think it's weird they did not want to biopsy the lump which is why i went in the first place.  It's in the same breast as the asymmetry.  I also think it should have been called focal asymmetry because it showed on two projections at least.  Please any more advice would be great.  The edc said it is possible if i had another mammo on my own that showed something suspicious they would maybe pay for the biopsy and mri.  But she did not know she just said if i have them done on my own and it suggests something more i should call and see if they will pay those.  Thanx for listening-it helps putting it all out here for others to see. Posts.Title: B9 but still questions what_ifs texasdonna

Posts.Content: Aug 31, 2011 11:46AM meme31 wrote: That's good news.  I don't want to needlessly worry you and i'm glad you feel better but asymmetry should be followed up with i thought.  More views are good but i don't believe it's true that if it was really there it should show up on all images the same.  It is unlikely to be a true lesion but it can hide in certain views.  It's good that they did so many views but just make sure you go back in a year.  And if you feel uncomfortable at any point or feel you want a more solid answer i think an US is certainly a good option to check it out and make sure.  I've researched a lot about asymmetry and that's why i was saying that. Rarely cancer can show as asymmetry hiding in certain views.

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2010 08:44PM meme31 wrote: this is a good thing i agree!  Better safe than sorry and just because they don't see something suspiciuos on there and they believe it to be ok does not mean it always is.  This site is full of women who had non suspicious things found and turned out as cancer-you just don't know what cancer looks like for sure and if it shows up on tests at all!  I've also learned how to be proactive for oneself because others often won't-it's our job and being young-i'm 31, and you are young as well means people might be more likely to dismiss something because it's not as common in younger women.  I'm finally getting a surgical consult on Dec. 2 for a small lump my doc found but that took a lot of annoying the proffessionals to agree to pay for it.  I'm getting the testing paid for through the edw because i don't have ins.  I'm not comfortable with someone saying it probably isn't anything bad.  Hang in there-odds are you will be just fine and will have a baseline of several tests to compare to should anything further arise.

Posts.Content: Aug 12, 2011 04:42PM meme31 wrote: It is a good sign they didn't see it.  Even though some docs think all lumps should be bx.  You have convinced yourself of something you have no proof of.  Take the ativan and STAY OFF THE COMPUTER, including this site.  IT just makes you feel you are doomed.  TAKE A BREAK!!  You are not dying of cancer right now and maybe never will.  You could die of a ridiculous blood clot or stroke or car accident any time.  Any number of completely random things could happen.  If you don't have a belief in Christ then maybe it's time to try it out.  A church you could visit, the lord is with you always and no matter what happens he will be.  Put your faith in him and you will find some peace.  I will say more prayers for you.  Maybe wait for your ins. to kick in and get the appt. with the bs so you can get some answers.  But for now please quit dx yourself and let the professionals do their job as best they can.

Posts.Content: meme31 wrote: So i've realized that my right boob gets really bumpy, not my left.  Does that matter?  I've been on here for nearly a year now so you can see old posts if necessary.  But the one lump that i think is big and hard, the gen. surgeon didn't see with us and felt it was only glandular tissue.  I disagree it hasn't gone away and i will see my midwife on Wed.  to see what she thinks.  Either way i am comfortable with her and will tell her my anxiety. Hopefully it goes away after my period. I don't start my period for probably another week and a half to two weeks and about a week ago i noticed a ridge if you will, of lumps a few centimeters away from the big lump.  It goes up and down next to my areola not in towards the nipple. It feels like a bigger one at the top and several(maybe four)littler ones strung down from it.  I think they are all connected but could be wrong.  It is very weird.  Maybe 3 or 4 cent. long. The only description i can think it compares to would be to run your hand along some gravel in the driveway.  No pain, breasts not sore.  I can almost always squeeze discharge out of that nipple.  Not the other one though-sometimes.  Any one else have this or ideas to it?  And i've wondered for a while now does it matter if you can feel a lump and it not just round, what direction it goes?  You know not just from the out in towards the nipple.  Obviously a round one doesn't actually go in a direction but a long one can.  I've also read a couple places lately that if you feel a lump and it turns out cancer than it's less likely to be an early stage-is that true or make any sense?  Thanx ladies for reading this!! Posts.Content: Oct 12, 2011 09:33PM meme31 wrote: Kelly, i'm not sure how to tell for you.  If it was round it wouldn't really go in any direction.  But the breast tissue i believe starts on the outer part of the breast and comes inward toward the nipple like a cone i guess.  So if it went along it or turned vertical that was what i was meaning.  Sherri, thanx for the info.  I think that's something so confusing about breast cancer.  Certain types aren't easily detected and add dense breast into that and more questions.  I imagine a thickening would not feel bumpy huh?  Just more like a piece of rubber maybe.  I don't think so though. I am lumpy bumpy anyway especially upper outer and don't know if i would ever notice a difference up there.  The ridge sort of goes from the upper outer to the lower outer just next to the areola, vertical.  I will see if it's still there after my period next week and make my appt. for after that week either way to check out the single lump, also lower outer-8-9oclock.  Doesn't feel 3d she said.  I heard someone else say that here a few weeks ago.  Not sure why that matters or exactly what that means.

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2011 02:55PM meme31 wrote: i thank God only had one leep procedure to remove mine.  I was awake though i felt pain.  Unfortunately i bled for about 45 min. afterward and had to lay there through fixing it and and all that went with it.  I didn't need to be given blood though.  The doc went out and got my husband and opened up her jacket and said see all this blood, it's your wifes.  Not very professional and it bothered him.  I bled after having my second child too.  Didn't need blood then either but again i had no pain meds or epidural and sat there for nearly an hour while she had one hand in me squeezing and the other on top pushing, or the other nurses were pushing they took turns, and giving me shots to finally get it stopped.  He was a month early too, thank God for that as well, his umbilical cord was tied in a complete knot.  She said she had only seen one other like that in five years. If he had stayed in i hate to think what could have happened. So med. wise i'm not exactly common and that's why i know shit can happen to anyone.  Wow you had to have a whole hysto. to get rid of yours, i'm sure all that was not a great time for you. I have 4 kids. Ya to you getting 3 around all that mess;) I will try to keep my balls close-thanx again! BTW, i love the ocean and all that's in it-so love your name and pic.

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2010 12:39PM - edited Oct 27, 2010 12:43PM by meme31 Well they scheduled an ultrasound for me on Fri. 05,so just over a week away.  If it's a cyst they should see the fluid-is that correct?  It won't pay for draining it but if it's a mass i think they will pay to have it biopsied-i don't have insurance but am getting this paid for through the EDC i believe it's called-early detection center.  If they see it and say it looks ok or if they don't see but i can still feel it should i insist on a biopsy?  It seems like yes, so i hope if it is a mass that i don't have to ask for it but i had to insist on an ultrasound so i should probably expect the same.   What sort of symptoms if any did you ladies have?  I haven't had any other than a lump and earlier this year i had a couple of times my nipple leaked through my clothes.  I've also had a tingling feeling at times in both breasts-i kind of feels like my boobs are getting full of breast milk and needing to be emptied-if that makes any sense to anyone-sorry for the silly description but that is how it felt,just tingling though and not the fullness.  I had my last child over four years ago and didn't breast feed him so definitely not from that but that is the best way i can describe it.  Thanx for listening!!
